content: On September 19, 1991, the Atlanta Braves achieved a significant milestone by clinching the National League West title. This victory was highlighted by a thrilling 6-4 win over the San Diego Padres, which solidified their spot in the postseason for the first time since moving to Atlanta. Led by manager Bobby Cox and stars like Tom Glavine and David Justice, this moment marked the beginning of a successful era for the Braves, culminating in their eventual trip to the World Series that year.
